description: Count subgroups of index 7 in C2 * C5 via homomorphism counts and generating-function identity.
knowledge_seeds: Identity: sum_{n>=0} h_n(G)/n! t^n = exp( sum_{n>=1} s_n(G)/n t^n ).
For free product G1*G2: h_n(G) = h_n(G1) * h_n(G2).
For cyclic C_k: generating function exp( sum_{d|k} t^d / d ); expand to t^7 for k in {2,5}.

nodes.instruction: State generating-function identity linking h_n and s_n; note h_n(C2*C5)=h_n(C2)h_n(C5).
Use Python to expand exp(sum_{d|k} t^d/d) for k=2 and k=5 up to t^7 to get h_n(C2), h_n(C5). Return coefficients list.
Multiply series of h_n(C2) and h_n(C5) termwise (up to n=7) to get h_n(C2*C5).
Take log of resulting series up to t^7; extract s_n via coefficient*n. Output s_7 and end with '#### <number>'. Expect 56.
Cross-check s_7=56 and that intermediate h_n align with OEIS sequences (A000085 for k=2, A052501 for k=5).
